oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: William Thurman
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: History of the First Regiment of Tennessee Cavalry. By William Thurman. Louisville, KY. Hart & Mapother, Printers. 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military leadership; History; Cavalry; Civil wars; Military personnel; Battlefields;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: HISTORY of the First Regiment of Tennessee Cavalry. BY WILLIAM THURMAN. Containing a correct account of the sufferings of the men of whom this Regiment was formed while they were effecting their escape from Rebels and Rebel tyranny in the beginning of the war, and fighting, and forcing their way across Cumberland Mountain in order to reach the Federal Camps; also giving sat- isfactory information relative to all the extensive marches, important skirm- ishes and battles, casualties, diseases and deaths which occurred during the organization of the Regiment. The reader will not fail to be pleased with narratives of the particular prowess of private soldiers and eulogizing sketches of the military character and conduct of the Commissioned Officers belonging to the Regiment. LOUISVILLE, KY. HART & MAPOTHER, Printers Corner of Third and Market Streets. 1865.
